cab.content: Printed for the War Cabinet. May 1945.CONFIDENTIAL. Copy No.W.P. (45) 320.23rd May, 1945.WAR CABINET.WAR CABINET DOCUMENTS.Note by the Prime Minister.MINISTERS are reminded that on relinquishing office they should handover to their successors all War Cabinet records required for currentadministration and should return to the Offices of the War Cabinet all war Cabinet documents not so required.2. This general rule will be subject to two provisos : (a) Ministers leaving office may take with them copies of War cabinet memoranda and other documents of State which they wrotethemselves. Duplicate copies will be provided, if required, for theuse of their Department.(b) Ministers of Cabinet rank may at any time have access in the cabinet offices to documents issued to them while they were in office.3. I look to all Ministers to assist the Secretary of the War Cabinet incarrying into effect the principles outlined above.4. Public disclosure of the contents of War Cabinet documents will be governed by the established rules. In particular, such documents may not be quoted or published without the permission of the Government of the day.w. s. c.10 Downing Street, S.W. 1,23rd May, 1945.
